definition[0]: to accept that an idea is right and allow it to influence you
example[0]: I never bought into this idea that you have to be thin to be attractive.
definition[1]: to buy part of a business or organization, especially because you want to control it
example[1]: Investors were invited to buy into state-owned enterprises.
definition[2]: to buy part of a company or business
example[2]: A lot of US companies are buying into Japanese firms.
example[3]: In momentum investing, the name of the game is being the first investor to buy into a stock, and the first investor to sell out before bad news breaks.
example[4]: My last employer expected us to buy into the ideas of every new American business guru, without question.
